elements.name: Auftrag
elements.title: Are the statements about consumer credit correct or incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Consumer credit agreements can be concluded in any form.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: Consumer credit agreements must be concluded in writing and the most important points must be listed in the agreement (Art. 9 ff. KKG).

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Anyone who regrets concluding a consumer credit agreement is out of luck; they are bound by the contract.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The consumer can revoke a consumer credit agreement in writing within 14 days (Art. 16 KKG).

elements.name: question5
elements.title: The lender must check the consumer's creditworthiness before taking out a consumer loan.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Justification:

elements.name: question7
elements.title: If the lender violates its obligations to check creditworthiness, it loses its claims to interest and costs.

elements.name: question8

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Contracts concluded for professional or commercial purposes are not subject to the Consumer Credit Act.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: A consumer loan is the cheapest way to finance your consumption.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The cheapest option is a cash purchase. Consumer credit incurs interest and other costs.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Are the statements about consumer credit correct or incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: The lender may charge any interest rate for a consumer loan.

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The Federal Council sets the maximum permissible interest rate for consumer credit agreements. This is currently 10%. A higher rate of 12% applies to credit and debit cards (Art. 1 of the Ordinance to the Consumer Credit Act, VKKG).

elements.name: question15
elements.title: Consumers must provide information about their financial situation before they can take out a consumer loan.

elements.title: The Consumer Credit Act applies to credit cards if the balance can be paid in installments.

elements.title: The period for revoking a consumer credit agreement begins as soon as the Central Credit Information Office approves the loan.

elements.name: question20
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The period for revoking a consumer credit agreement begins as soon as the consumer has received a copy of the agreement.
